com.bulletphysics.dynamics.constraintsolver

Class Generic6DofConstraint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bulletphysics.dynamics.constraintsolver.TypedConstraint
      • com.bulletphysics.dynamics.constraintsolver.Generic6DofConstraint
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Generic6DofSpringConstraint

    public class Generic6DofConstraint
extends TypedConstraint
    Generic6DofConstraint between two rigid bodies each with a pivot point that describes the axis location in local space.

    Generic6DofConstraint can leave any of the 6 degree of freedom "free" or "locked". Currently this limit supports rotational motors.

    • For linear limits, use setLinearUpperLimit(javax.vecmath.Vector3f), setLinearLowerLimit(javax.vecmath.Vector3f). You can set the parameters with the TranslationalLimitMotor structure accessible through the getTranslationalLimitMotor() method.
    • For angular limits, use the RotationalLimitMotor structure for configuring the limit. This is accessible through getRotationalLimitMotor(int) method, this brings support for limit parameters and motors.
    • Angulars limits have these possible ranges:
      AXIS MIN ANGLE MAX ANGLE
      X -PI PI
      Y -PI/2 PI/2
      Z -PI/2 PI/2
    Author:
    jezek2

    • Method Detail

      • calculateTransforms

        public void calculateTransforms()
        Calcs global transform of the offsets.

        Calcs the global transform for the joint offset for body A an B, and also calcs the angle differences between the bodies. See also: Generic6DofConstraint.getCalculatedTransformA, Generic6DofConstraint.getCalculatedTransformB, Generic6DofConstraint.calculateAngleInfo

      • testAngularLimitMotor

        public boolean testAngularLimitMotor(int axis_index)
        Test angular limit.

        Calculates angular correction and returns true if limit needs to be corrected. Generic6DofConstraint.buildJacobian must be called previously.

      • testLinearLimitMotor

        public boolean testLinearLimitMotor(int axis_index)
        Test linear limit.

        Calculates linear correction and returns true if limit needs to be corrected. Generic6DofConstraint.buildJacobian must be called previously.

      • isLimited

        public boolean isLimited(int limitIndex)
        Test limit.

        - free means upper < lower,
        - locked means upper == lower
        - limited means upper > lower
        - limitIndex: first 3 are linear, next 3 are angular
